annotation_filters.description: A comma separated list of filters to apply to putative annotations

draw_fusions_only.description: Flag to indicate if events which do not produce a fusion transcript should produce illustrations

draw_non_synonymous_cdna_only.description: Flag to indicate if events which are synonymous at the cdna level should produce illustrations

max_orf_cap.description: The maximum number of orfs to return (best putative orfs will be retained)

min_domain_mapping_match.description: A number between 0 and 1 representing the minimum percent match a domain must map to the fusion transcript to be displayed

min_orf_size.description: The minimum length (in base pairs) to retain a putative open reading frame (orf)

bam_stats.description: settings which affect how the bam stats are calculated

distribution_fraction.description: the proportion of the distribution to use in computing stdev

sample_bin_size.description: how large to make the sample bin (in bp)

sample_cap.description: maximum number of reads to collect for any given sample region

sample_size.description: the number of genes/bins to compute stats over

cluster_initial_size_limit.description: The maximum cumulative size of both breakpoints for breakpoint pairs to be used in the initial clustering phase (combining based on overlap)

cluster_radius.description: Maximum distance allowed between paired breakpoint pairs

limit_to_chr.description: A list of chromosome names to use. breakpointpairs on other chromosomes will be filteredout. for example '1 2 3 4' would filter out events/breakpoint pairs on any chromosomes but 1, 2, 3, and 4

max_files.description: The maximum number of files to output from clustering/splitting

max_proximity.description: The maximum distance away from an annotation before the region in considered to be uninformative

min_clusters_per_file.description: The minimum number of breakpoint pairs to output to a file

split_only.description: just split the input files, do not merge input breakpoints into clusters

uninformative_filter.description: Flag that determines if breakpoint pairs which are not within max_proximity to any annotations are filtered out prior to clustering

assume_no_untemplated.description: Assume the lack of untemplated information means that there IS not untemplated sequence expected at the breakpoints

file_type.description: the tool the file is input from or 'mavis' for standard mavis-style tab files

domain_name_regex_filter.description: The regular expression used to select domains to be displayed (filtered by name)

domain_scaffold_color.description: The color of the domain scaffold

drawing_width_iter_increase.description: The amount (in  pixels) by which to increase the drawing width upon failure to fit

exon_min_focus_size.description: Minimum size of an exon for it to be granted a label or min exon width

gene1_color.description: The color of genes near the first gene

gene1_color_selected.description: The color of the first gene

gene2_color.description: The color of genes near the second gene

gene2_color_selected.description: The color of the second gene

mask_fill.description: Color of mask (for deleted region etc.)

max_drawing_retries.description: The maximum number of retries for attempting a drawing. each iteration the width is extended. if it is still insufficient after this number a gene-level only drawing will be output

scaffold_color.description: The color used for the gene/transcripts scaffolds

strand_determining_read.description: 1 or 2. the read in the pair which determines if (assuming a stranded protocol) the first or second read in the pair matches the strand sequenced

contig_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by contig) in order for them to pair

flanking_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by flanking pairs) in order for them to pair

input_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by input tools, not validated) in order for them to pair

spanning_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by spanning reads) in order for them to pair

split_call_distance.description: The maximum distance allowed between breakpoint pairs (called by split reads) in order for them to pair

annotation_memory.description: Default memory limit (mb) for the annotation stage

concurrency_limit.description: The concurrency limit for tasks in any given job array or the number of concurrent processes allowed for a local run

mail_type.description: When to notify the mail_user (if given)

memory_limit.description: The maximum number of megabytes (mb) any given job is allowed

queue.description: The queue jobs are to be submitted to

remote_head_ssh.description: Ssh target for remote scheduler commands

time_limit.description: The time in seconds any given jobs is allowed

trans_validation_memory.description: Default memory limit (mb) for the validation stage (for transcriptomes)

validation_memory.description: Default memory limit (mb) for the validation stage

filter_cdna_synon.description: Filter all annotations synonymous at the cdna level

filter_min_complexity.description: Filter event calls based on call sequence complexity

filter_min_flanking_reads.description: Minimum number of flanking pairs for a call by flanking pairs

filter_min_linking_split_reads.description: Minimum number of linking split reads for a call by split reads

filter_min_remapped_reads.description: Minimum number of remapped reads for a call by contig

filter_min_spanning_reads.description: Minimum number of spanning reads for a call by spanning reads

filter_min_split_reads.description: Minimum number of split reads for a call by split reads

filter_protein_synon.description: Filter all annotations synonymous at the protein level

filter_trans_homopolymers.description: Filter all single bp ins/del/dup events that are in a homopolymer region of at least 3 bps and are not paired to a genomic event

aligner.description: The aligner to use to map the contigs/reads back to the reference e.g blat or bwa

assembly_kmer_size.description: The percent of the read length to make kmers for assembly

assembly_max_paths.description: The maximum number of paths to resolve. this is used to limit when there is a messy assembly graph to resolve. the assembly will pre-calculate the number of paths (or putative assemblies) and stop if it is greater than the given setting

assembly_min_edge_trim_weight.description: This is used to simplify the debruijn graph before path finding. edges with less than this frequency will be discarded if they are non-cutting, at a fork, or the end of a path

assembly_min_exact_match_to_remap.description: The minimum length of exact matches to initiate remapping a read to a contig

assembly_min_remap_coverage.description: Minimum fraction of the contig sequence which the remapped sequences must align over

assembly_min_remapped_seq.description: The minimum input sequences that must remap for an assembled contig to be used

assembly_min_uniq.description: Minimum percent uniq required to keep separate assembled contigs. if contigs are more similar then the lower scoring, then shorter, contig is dropped

assembly_strand_concordance.description: When the number of remapped reads from each strand are compared, the ratio must be above this number to decide on the strand

blat_limit_top_aln.description: Number of results to return from blat (ranking based on score)

blat_min_identity.description: The minimum percent identity match required for blat results when aligning contigs

call_error.description: Buffer zone for the evidence window

clean_aligner_files.description: Remove the aligner output files after the validation stage is complete. not required for subsequent steps but can be useful in debugging and deep investigation of events

contig_aln_max_event_size.description: Relates to determining breakpoints when pairing contig alignments. for any given read in a putative pair the soft clipping is extended to include any events of greater than this size. the softclipping is added to the side of the alignment as indicated by the breakpoint we are assigning pairs to

contig_aln_merge_inner_anchor.description: The minimum number of consecutive exact match base pairs to not merge events within a contig alignment

contig_aln_merge_outer_anchor.description: Minimum consecutively aligned exact matches to anchor an end for merging internal events

contig_aln_min_anchor_size.description: The minimum number of aligned bases for a contig (m or =) in order to simplify. do not have to be consecutive

contig_aln_min_extend_overlap.description: Minimum number of bases the query coverage interval must be extended by in order to pair alignments as a single split alignment

contig_aln_min_query_consumption.description: Minimum fraction of the original query sequence that must be used by the read(s) of the alignment

contig_aln_min_score.description: Minimum score for a contig to be used as evidence in a call by contig

fetch_min_bin_size.description: The minimum size of any bin for reading from a bam file. increasing this number will result in smaller bins being merged or less bins being created (depending on the fetch method)

fetch_reads_bins.description: Number of bins to split an evidence window into to ensure more even sampling of high coverage regions

fetch_reads_limit.description: Maximum number of reads, cap, to loop over for any given evidence window

filter_secondary_alignments.description: Filter secondary alignments when gathering read evidence

fuzzy_mismatch_number.description: The number of events/mismatches allowed to be considered a fuzzy match

max_sc_preceeding_anchor.description: When remapping a softclipped read this determines the amount of softclipping allowed on the side opposite of where we expect it. for example for a softclipped read on a breakpoint with a left orientation this limits the amount of softclipping that is allowed on the right. if this is set to none then there is no limit on softclipping

min_anchor_exact.description: Applies to re-aligning softclipped reads to the opposing breakpoint. the minimum number of consecutive exact matches to anchor a read to initiate targeted realignment

min_anchor_fuzzy.description: Applies to re-aligning softclipped reads to the opposing breakpoint. the minimum length of a fuzzy match to anchor a read to initiate targeted realignment

min_anchor_match.description: Minimum percent match for a read to be kept as evidence

min_call_complexity.description: The minimum complexity score for a call sequence. is an average for non-contig calls. filters low complexity contigs before alignment. see [contig_complexity](#contig_complexity)

min_double_aligned_to_estimate_insertion.description: The minimum number of reads which map soft-clipped to both breakpoints to assume the size of the untemplated sequence between the breakpoints is at most the read length - 2 * min_softclipping

min_flanking_pairs_resolution.description: The minimum number of flanking reads required to call a breakpoint by flanking evidence

min_linking_split_reads.description: The minimum number of split reads which aligned to both breakpoints

min_mapping_quality.description: The minimum mapping quality of reads to be used as evidence

min_non_target_aligned_split_reads.description: The minimum number of split reads aligned to a breakpoint by the input bam and no forced by local alignment to the target region to call a breakpoint by split read evidence

min_sample_size_to_apply_percentage.description: Minimum number of aligned bases to compute a match percent. if there are less than this number of aligned bases (match or mismatch) the percent comparator is not used

min_softclipping.description: Minimum number of soft-clipped bases required for a read to be used as soft-clipped evidence

min_spanning_reads_resolution.description: Minimum number of spanning reads required to call an event by spanning evidence

min_splits_reads_resolution.description: Minimum number of split reads required to call a breakpoint by split reads

outer_window_min_event_size.description: The minimum size of an event in order for flanking read evidence to be collected

stdev_count_abnormal.description: The number of standard deviations away from the normal considered expected and therefore not qualifying as flanking reads

trans_fetch_reads_limit.description: Related to [fetch_reads_limit](#fetch_reads_limit). overrides fetch_reads_limit for transcriptome libraries when set. if this has a value of none then fetch_reads_limit will be used for transcriptome libraries instead

trans_min_mapping_quality.description: Related to [min_mapping_quality](#min_mapping_quality). overrides the min_mapping_quality if the library is a transcriptome and this is set to any number not none. if this value is none, min_mapping_quality is used for transcriptomes aswell as genomes

write_evidence_files.description: Write the intermediate bam and bed files containing the raw evidence collected and contigs aligned. not required for subsequent steps but can be useful in debugging and deep investigation of events
